private_information: I currently hold the disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Disk A is the smallest and disk H is the largest.
Only the top disk may be moved from this peg at any time.
left_peg.goal: Support the orchestration to move all disks to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can receive or send at most one top disk move at a time.
middle_peg.goal: Support the orchestration to move disks while respecting the rules that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.

private_information: My final desired state is to hold all disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
right_peg.goal: Support the orchestration to become the final peg containing all disks in correct order.

private_information: I coordinate the other agents to achieve the global goal.
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem suited for the FastDownwards planner.
orchestrator.goal: Generate a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance with pegs left, middle, and right and that can be solved by FastDownwards.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initially, left peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Initially, middle peg is empty and right peg is empty.
The goal is to have the right peg contain all disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H while left and middle pegs are empty.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the left peg. Describe your current stack and list the legal moves that can be performed from your peg given the Tower of Hanoi rules.
report.prompt: You are the left_peg agent. Use your private information and the environment public information to report your current state concisely and enumerate which single-disk moves from this peg to other pegs are currently legal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that must produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem encoding the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Model pegs left, middle, and right and disks A through H. Ensure actions and predicates are compatible with classical STRIPS-style FastDownwards usage. Keep agent responsibilities distinct in comments or predicate naming if needed.
pddl.prompt: You receive state reports from the three peg agents and the public environment information. Integrate these reports and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that capture the initial configuration and the goal for moving all disks to the right peg. The PDDL must be solvable by the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
